CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 18, 1958, pg. 7, reads: "Two Hurt as Plaster Falls - Young Larry Lewis Bond who lives with his mother at 1206 Herron Ave., points to pile of plaster covered with quilt which fell from hole above last Thursday in their home injuring him and his mother, Mrs. Frances Bond shown in bed (right) as a result of her injuries.  Center photo shows a close up of the ceiling light and the hole which the falling plaster left in ceiling of the bedroom. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Frances Bond wearing head scarf lying in bed under chenille bedspread, after injury from fallen plaster, in her bedroom at 1206 Herron Avenue
